short_instructions.https://studio.code.org/s/k1hoc2017/stag:
This is Laurel the Adventurer! 

Press "Run" to see her walk up to the treasure and grab it.

Great!  Now you get to add code yourself!  

Snap a `get treasure` block to the bottom of the program and click "Run".
Snap two `E -->` blocks and one `get treasure` block to the bottom of the program, then click "Run".
Can you figure out how to solve this puzzle?
Get 1 of these 2 gems to solve this puzzle.
Get both pieces of treasure to solve this puzzle.
Get all three piles to pass this level.
Fix Laurel's path to get all of this treasure.
Use what you learned to get all of the treasure.
Add blocks to this code to get all of the treasure.
What should you add to this code to get all of the treasure?
Write code to get all of this treasure.
_"Eureka!  Get as much treasure as you can!"_
_"Can you help me spot some bugs?"_

long_instructions.https://studio.code.org/s/k1hoc2017/stag:
This is Laurel the Adventurer! 

Press "Run" to see her walk up to the treasure and grab it.

Great!  Now you get to add code yourself!  

Snap a [][0] block to the bottom of the program and click "Run"!
To grab the treasure, snap two [][0] blocks and one [][1] block to the bottom of the program and click "Run"!

Get all three piles! Move Laurel to each piece of treasure, then use this block:
  <xml><block type="collector_collect"/></xml>
How can Laurel get all five piles of treasure using only one <xml><block type="maze_moveEast"/></xml> block?

_"Eureka!  Get as much treasure as you can!"_  
(You do not have to get it all.)
_"Can you help me spot some bugs? I know which way I want to go, but I'm not sure how many steps to take."_

https://studio.code.org/s/k1hoc2017/stag.courseA_collector_preLoops4_a: To grab the treasure, snap two [][0] blocks and one [][1] block to the bottom of the program and click "Run"!

https://studio.code.org/s/k1hoc2017/stag.courseA_collector_preLoops5_a: You'll need to go two different directions to get even one gem!

https://studio.code.org/s/k1hoc2017/stag.courseA_collector_preLoops6_a: You will need to use two [][0] blocks to solve this puzzle.

https://studio.code.org/s/k1hoc2017/stag.courseA_collector_loops2_b:
After you have moved to a square with treasure, use this block to pick it up.

<xml>  <block type="collector_collect"/></xml>

https://studio.code.org/s/k1hoc2017/stag.courseA_collector_loops3_a: Try using a <xml><block type="controls_repeat_simplified_dropdown"><title name="TIMES" config="3-10">???</title></block></xml> loop!
https://studio.code.org/s/k1hoc2017/stag.courseA_collector_loops3_b: Remember, you can put more than 1 block inside a <xml><block type="controls_repeat_simplified_dropdown"><title name="TIMES" config="3-10">???</title></block></xml> loop.

https://studio.code.org/s/k1hoc2017/stag.courseA_collector_loops4_a: To change how far Laurel goes, change the number of times that the loop runs.
https://studio.code.org/s/k1hoc2017/stag.courseA_collector_loops4_b: Don't forget that Laurel needs to walk down and collect the treasure after she finishes the <xml><block type="controls_repeat_simplified_dropdown"><title name="TIMES" config="3-10">???</title></block></xml> loop!

https://studio.code.org/s/k1hoc2017/stag.courseA_collector_loops5_a: If you can't figure out the answer right away, try using a piece of paper to figure out what arrows you will need and look for a pattern.
https://studio.code.org/s/k1hoc2017/stag.courseA_collector_loops5_b: Try splitting the problem into 2 parts, moving sideways and then down.
https://studio.code.org/s/k1hoc2017/stag.courseA_collector_loops5_c: You'll want to start with a <xml><block type="controls_repeat_simplified_dropdown"><title name="TIMES" config="3-10">???</title></block></xml> loop that moves Laurel west and collects treasure.

https://studio.code.org/s/k1hoc2017/stag.courseA_collector_loops6_a: Can't figure out what's wrong? Try running the code a couple of times to see what happens.
https://studio.code.org/s/k1hoc2017/stag.courseA_collector_loops6_b: The shortest solution has 2 <xml><block type="controls_repeat_simplified_dropdown"><title name="TIMES" config="3-10">???</title></block></xml> loops, one after the other.

https://studio.code.org/s/k1hoc2017/stag.courseA_collector_loops7_a: If you can't figure out what comes next, try running the code to see where Laurel ends up.

https://studio.code.org/s/k1hoc2017/stag.courseA_collector_loops8_a: If you are having trouble figuring this puzzle out, try writing the moves down on a piece of paper and looking for a pattern.
https://studio.code.org/s/k1hoc2017/stag.courseA_collector_loops8_b: Try breaking this puzzle into 3 separate problems, and writing loops for each.
https://studio.code.org/s/k1hoc2017/stag.courseA_collector_loops8_c: Remember you can write one piece of the code at a time, then press "Run" to figure out where you need to go from there.

https://studio.code.org/s/k1hoc2017/stag.courseA_collector_loops_challenge1_a: Try changing the numbers in each loop if something seems wrong.
https://studio.code.org/s/k1hoc2017/stag.courseA_collector_loops_challenge1_b: You don't need to use a loop if you are only doing something one time.
https://studio.code.org/s/k1hoc2017/stag.courseA_collector_loops_challenge1_c: There are 6 gems on the right side of the cave when you start, but you only need to get treasure 5 times moving South. Do you know why?
https://studio.code.org/s/k1hoc2017/stag.courseA_collector_loops_challenge1_d:
The starting program doesn't collect the last 2 gems. Try adding this code at the very end:

<xml><block type="maze_moveEast">
                        <next>
                          <block type="collector_collect_simplified">
                            <next>
                              <block type="maze_moveSouth">
                                <next>
                                  <block type="collector_collect"/>
                                </next>
                              </block>
                            </next>
                          </block>
                        </next>
                      </block></xml>

https://studio.code.org/s/k1hoc2017/stag.courseA_collector_loops_challenge2_b: You only need to use 1 block to solve this.
https://studio.code.org/s/k1hoc2017/stag.courseA_collector_loops_challenge2_a: You can move back over the path a second time before moving south.

https://studio.code.org/s/k1hoc2017/stag.courseA_collector_preLoops1_1: Click here to watch the code run!

https://studio.code.org/s/k1hoc2017/stag.courseA_collector_loops1_1: Do you see some new blocks in the toolbox?  Don't worry, we will show you how to use them later in the stage.
Do you see some new blocks in the toolbox?  Don't worry, we will show you how to use them later in the stage.
Do you see some new blocks in the toolbox?  Don't worry, we will show you how to use them later in the stage.
Do you see some new blocks in the toolbox?  Don't worry, we will show you how to use them later in the stage.
Do you see some new blocks in the toolbox?  Don't worry, we will show you how to use them later in the stage.

https://studio.code.org/s/k1hoc2017/stag.gradek_adventurer_loops2_1: This number tells you how many of these blocks you can use in this puzzle.
